channel.title: Can someone explain paint(Graphics g) and it's relation to Swing?
channel.description: Or does it even have a relation? How would I make something made in Swing update whenever someone does something?

item.title: Can someone explain paint(Graphics g) and it's relation to Swing?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

AWT might be stone age (if 10 years ago is considered an age ago :P), but it’s still useful. And basically all swing components, such as JFrame and JComponent, extend on awt components, Frame and Container/Component respectively.

paint() is called, even in swing, to “refresh” heavyweight components. repaint() and update() can therefore be called in mostly any gui component, swing or awt, to “refresh” it. I don’t believe it repaints subcomponents though, but to be honest I’m not entirely sure, which is my reasoning for not going into an in depth explanation. Here’s a good article that might answer some of your questions though: http://java.sun.com/products/jfc/tsc/articles/painting/

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone explain paint(Graphics g) and it's relation to Swing?

item.title: Can someone explain paint(Graphics g) and it's relation to Swing?
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Yeah, I know about action listeners. I guess I kind of asked the question wrong. For example in the Runescape client in Frame_Sub_1 there’s paint(Graphics g), but that’s implementing AWT (stone age). I was wondering if paint() has any relevancy at all to Swing. Thanks

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone explain paint(Graphics g) and it's relation to Swing?

item.title: Can someone explain paint(Graphics g) and it's relation to Swing?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Swing does have a relation to Graphics (since it implements the awt package), but I believe what you’re talking about is event listening…as in, if the user clicks a button then perform a certain action, right?

If so, I’d read up on exactly that: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/events/index.html

If that’s not what you want, or if you want some help with specific elements, post some code and I’ll give you a hand

Read full topic
